decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: LP/02; 12732/939 Rev 2; Location Plan

Condition : 3 - Noise Levels - Due to potential impact on the surrounding locality from the mechanical plant, the noise criteria and mitigation recommendations to protect the noise impact on the noise sensitive properties as specified in the Soundtesting Acoustic Consultancy, Plant Noise Impact Assessment, dated 27 August 2024 Report reference: UA2708.20082724.JD shall be implemented and maintained as a minimum standard.  A post installation compliance assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 4 weeks of the first use of the extraction equipment hereby approved.


Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following policies: policy D14 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2, DM D3 & DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 4 - (Odour) The level of odour control shall meet the requirements for a 'High Level of Odour Control' as specified in the Air Quality Assessments Ltd risk assessment in accordance with the EMAQ+ 'Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems' guidance document dated 2018 as a minimum standard.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of surrounding area and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay
